Unit level data of Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS).

Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) is the primary source of data on employment and unemployment situation of the country for estimating various labour market indicators like Labour Force Participation Rate (LFPR), Worker Population Ratio (WPR) and Unemployment Rate (UR), etc.

Levels of disaggregation at which different employment and unemployment indicators are presented includes:
•State
•Sector (rural, urban)
•Gender
•Age group
•Level of education

Classifications used

Industry: National Industrial Classification (NIC) -2008. NIC-2008 is comparable with International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC) (Revision 4) till 4-digit classes in totality.

Occupation: national Classification of Occupation (NCO)-2015. NCO-2015 is aligned with International Standard Classification of Occupation (ISCO) 2008.

The following industry sections as per National Industrial Classification (NIC-2008) are covered in PLFS:
Section A: Agriculture, forestry and fishing
Section B: Mining and quarryingSection 
C: Manufacturing

Section F: Construction

Section I: Accommodation and Food service activities
Section J: Information and communication

In PLFS information is collected from the members of the surveyed household. Apart from person level information some household level information is also collected in PLFS.

PLFS covers the whole of the Indian Union except the villages in Andaman and Nicobar Islands which are difficult to access throughout the year. Population coverage.

The coverage of population in the survey are determined with the following guidelines:1. Under-trial prisoners in jails and indoor patients of hospitals, nursing homes etc., are to be excluded, but residential staff therein will be listed while listing is done in such institutions. The persons of the first category will be considered as normal members of their parent households and will be counted there. Convicted prisoners undergoing sentence will be outside the coverage of the survey.2. Floating population, i.e., persons without any normal residence will not be listed. But households residing in open space, roadside shelter, under a bridge, etc., more or less regularly in the same place, will be listed.3. Foreign nationals will not be listed, nor their domestic servants, if by definition the latter belong to the foreign national's household. If, however, a foreign national becomes an Indian citizen for all practical purposes, he or she will be covered. 4. Persons residing in barracks of military and paramilitary forces (like police, BSF, etc.) will be kept outside the survey coverage due to difficulty in conduct of survey therein. However, civilian population residing in their neighborhood, including the family quarters of service personnel, are to be covered. Permission for this may have to be obtained from appropriate authorities.5. Orphanages, rescue homes, ashrams and vagrant houses are outside the survey coverage. However, persons staying in old age homes, students staying in ashrams/ hostels and the residential staff (other than monks/ nuns) of these ashrams may be listed. For orphanages, although orphans are not to be listed, the persons looking after them and staying there may be considered for listing.

Two types of reference period are used in PLFS for determining activity status of a household member:
•For determining the Usual Activity Status (ps+ss), the reference period is last 365 days from the date of survey.
•For determining the Current Weekly Status (CWS), the reference period is last 7 days from the date of survey.

Since its launch in 2017 to December 2024, the samples in PLFS were canvassed on a quarterly basis. For the quarterly bulletins of PLFS the samples surveyed during the concerned quarter was considered. 

For Annual report the survey covering period July of any year to June of the following year, the quarterly samples covered during the quarter July-September, October - December, January - March and April - June falling within the July-June survey period were considered. 

Similarly for calendar year results the quarters January - March, April - June, July-September and October - December of a specific calendar year are considered.

The sample design of PLFS has been revamped from January 2025. In the revamped sample design, the data is collected on a monthly basis. 

The monthly results from PLFS are brought out based on information collected during a specific month. 

The quarterly and calendar year wise estimates would be brought out by considering the information collected during the corresponding months falling within the quarter and calendar year.

Upto December 2024, PLFS sample size was around 1,02,400 households from 12,800 First Stage Units (FSUs: census 2011 villages in rural areas and UFS blocks in urban areas)

From January 2025, the PLFS sample size is 2,72,304 households from 22,692 FSUs (census 2011 villages in rural areas and UFS blocks in urban areas).

To ensure quality, monitoring is ensured at each step the of survey including field inspection, scrutiny, various stages of validation, checking for consistency of the tables, etc.

Data collection is done using CAPI with in-built validation; checking for completeness of data and data quality during the survey is done on regular basis; rigorous checking followed in data; Therefore, all the results are subjected to rigorous monitoring of the survey work and intensive checking/validation of data and tables at each stage of processing.
The Relative Standard Error (RSE) of the key employment and unemployment indicators are presented in the published results of PLFS.

Relative Standard Error (RSE) of estimates Labour Force Participation Rate (LFPR), Worker Population ratio (WPR) and Unemployment Rate (UR) at all-India and State level and industrial distribution of employed persons are brought out.

Coverage of economic activities used in PLFS to determine the activity status of the household members broadly matches with the production boundary of System of National Accounts (SNA 2008) followed.

PLFS is a continuous survey.
Since the launch of PLFS in 2017 to December, 2024 PLFS data was collected on a quarterly basis. 

The sample design of PLFS has been revamped from January 2025. In the revamped sample design, the data is collected on a monthly basis.
Data is collected through personal interviewing method through CAPI with in-built validation.
Collected data is validated through a set of scrutiny programmes and other consistency checks.
Data compilation is done through a dedicated team of HSD. Design based weights are derived as per the sampling design to calculate the estimates in rates/ratios.

Both Household level and person level data are identified for the purpose of analysis through a masked identifiers method which ensures the confidentiality of the surveyed individuals and households in accordance with the fundamental principles of official statistics.
